text:
Kate and William visit BBC to learn about anti-bullying project

Kate and Prince William already have three children together - Prince George, Princess Charlotte and Prince Louis. As Prince William’s brother Prince Harry is expecting his first child with Meghan Markle, bookies have slashed the odds on the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge expecting a baby as well. Bookies Coral have released odds over a sudden announcement from the future King and Queen of England as the odds now shows the chance of Kate being pregnant at 1/2 - a 50 percent chance.

Coral's Harry Aitkenhead said: "Our odds show that there's every chance that Kate and Wills might add to their growing family, and a fourth baby is certainly a possibility. “We've taken some bets over the last two weeks or so on it happening and there's a real buzz around the Royal family at the moment with Meghan expecting.” But whether the Duchess of Cambridge will follow in the Queen’s footstep by having four children is yet to be confirmed. One source has said he does not think Kate will have more children as he thinks “Kate is done” after suffering extreme morning sickness throughout her three previous pregnancies.

Kate Middleton: The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge already have three children together

Kate Middleton pregnant: Prince William and Kate has three children together

The source told People magazine: "I can’t imagine Kate will want any more given the ordeal that she goes through every pregnancy. “I should think that three children is enough." A source also told Express.co.uk the Duchess had to convince Prince William to have a third child, because she "always wanted more than two children". The source said: ”As one of three, Kate wanted at least three.

Prince William reveals Prince George loves dancing like Diana

Kate and Prince William at Prince Louis' christening

“William was more reluctant, not just because he was one of two, but because George was quite a difficult baby. "Then they had Charlotte and she was a lot easier. “Now the idea of a newborn doesn’t seem half as challenging." The royal couple is also thought to already have their hands full with taking care of Prince George, Princess Charlotte and Prince Louis.
